conclusion: Identify the need to find the magnitude of the Ampere force and resistance value of R2.
List given data including distance between rails, mass of rod, resistance of rod, magnetic field, electromotive force, internal resistance, angle of incline, and gravitational acceleration.
Determine that forces are balanced since the rod is stationary, equating Ampere force to gravitational force component.
Calculate Ampere force as 0.085 N using F = mg sin theta.
Use the formula F = B I d to solve for current I.
Calculate current I as approximately 0.944 A.
Use Ohm's Law to determine total resistance in the circuit.
Calculate total resistance as approximately 10.6 ohms.
Solve for R2 using the formula R2 = E/I - R1 - r.
Round the magnitude of the Ampere force to 0.1 N and resistance value of R2 to 6 ohms.
